\usepackage[latin9]{luainputenc}
\usepackage{geometry}

\usepackage{amstext}
\usepackage{amssymb}
\usepackage{babel}
\begin{document}
\title{Math 320 HW 2}
\date{Due: Jan. 23, 2023 at Midnight}
\maketitle

\section*{1)}

For the following functions, determine if the function is onto, one-to-one,
both, or neither. Provide an argument for your reasoning.
\begin{enumerate}
\item $f:\mathbb{R}^{+}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}$, $f\left(x\right)=x^{2}$
\item $f:\mathbb{R}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}$, $f\left(x\right)=x^{2}$
\item $f:\mathbb{R}^{+}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}^{+}$, $f\left(x\right)=x^{2}$
\item $f:\mathbb{R}^{4}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}^{4},f\left(\begin{array}{c}
a\\
b\\
c\\
d
\end{array}\right)=\left(\begin{array}{c}
c\\
a\\
d\\
b
\end{array}\right)$
\end{enumerate}

\section*{2)}

Let $f:A\rightarrow B$ and $A_{0},A_{1}\subseteq A$. Show the following:
\begin{enumerate}
\item $f\left(A_{0}\right)\subseteq f\left(A\right)$
\item $f\left(A_{0}\cup A_{1}\right)=f\left(A_{0}\right)\cup f\left(A_{1}\right)$
\item $f\left(A_{0}\cap A_{1}\right)\subseteq f\left(A_{0}\right)\cap f\left(A_{1}\right)$
in general and $f\left(A_{0}\cap A_{1}\right)=f\left(A_{0}\right)\cap f\left(A_{1}\right)$
if $f$ is one-to-one (injective).
\end{enumerate}

\section*{3)}

Determine if the following relations are equivalence relations, anti-symmetric
relations, asymmetric relations, or neither. Provide an explanation
for each claim.
\begin{enumerate}
\item $R=\subseteq$
\item $R=\subsetneq$
\item $x,y\in\left\{ \text{triangles in }\mathbb{R}^{2}\right\} $, $xRy\iff x,y\ \text{are similar triangles}$
\end{enumerate}

\section*{4)}

Determine if each of the given functions are binary operations. If
a given function is a binary operation, determine if the binary operation
is associative and commutative.
\begin{enumerate}
\item $a-b$ for positive integers $a,b$
\item $a*b$ for rational $a,b$
\item $AB$ for invertible $n\times n$ matrices $A,B$
\item $\frac{a}{b}$ for rational $a,b$
\item $\left|a\right|\left|b\right|$ for complex numbers $a,b$
\end{enumerate}

\section*{5)}

Let $X$ be a set. How many binary operations $f:X\times X\rightarrow X$
are there if:
\begin{enumerate}
\item $|X|=2$
\item $|X|=3$
\item $|X|=4$
\end{enumerate}

\end{document}
